node.title: Back to full capacity and on the hunt for Legos in New Jersey.
node.alt: Karl Tangara hauls his cart from the Lego store through the Garden State Plaza mall in Paramus, N.J.
node.description: A father of three got some Christmas shopping done and the Garden State Plaza expected a busy day.
node.content: ["PARAMUS, N.J. \u2014 Karl Tangara, a father of three, hurried into the Garden State Plaza mall\u2019s east entry at 6:45 a.m. on Black Friday, pulled a handcart with three blue IKEA bags folded beneath a strap and approached Jay Daly, the mall\u2019s senior general manager.", "\u201cWhich way to the Lego store?\u201d Mr. Tangara asked.", "Mr. Daly pointed down the second-floor corridor with his two-way radio and detailed the path. Mr. Tangara thanked him and took off, passing customers standing in a long line at Lululemon, teenagers posing for selfies in front of Christmas decorations and workers vacuuming display windows before opening their doors.", "\u201cI just need Legos,\u201d Mr. Tangara, 43, said. \u201cEverything else I can do online.\u201d", "Customers returned to the Bergen County shopping center on a rainy morning for holiday discounts. At Morphe, the health and beauty store, signs advertised \u201cONE. BIG. SALE-A-BRATION.\u201d with products going for up to 70 percent off. At Pacsun, there were reminders of the economy\u2019s needs. A buy-one-get-one-free poster was displayed in the same window as two announcements that the store needed assistant managers.", "\u201cWe\u2019re expecting a fairly busy day,\u201d Mr. Daly said as he watched the doors at Macy\u2019s open.", "Last year, government restrictions limited the mall to 50 percent capacity on the busiest day of the retail calendar, but there were no such limits this year. Christmas music played as shoppers moved from store to store, and a steady stream of patrons flowing in and out during the morning.", "Mr. Tangara spent more than a half-hour in the Lego store. When he checked out, he had filled all three of his IKEA bags with gift boxes for his children and collectible sets for him and his wife. He was out the door by 8 a.m.", "\u201cI have another Thanksgiving with family,\u201d he said, hauling his gifts into the parking lot."]
